thread.title: Samsung Galaxy S8 to reportedly be unveiled on March 29th, price tipped alongside
thread.title_full: Samsung Galaxy S8 to reportedly be unveiled on March 29th, price tipped alongside

title: Samsung Galaxy S8 to reportedly be unveiled on March 29th, price tipped alongside
text:
Samsung Galaxy S8 to reportedly be unveiled on March 29th, price tipped... Samsung Galaxy S8 to reportedly be unveiled on March 29th, price tipped alongside By - January 17, 2017 “The Galaxy S8 is rumoured to be powered by a Snapdragon 835 SoC, mated to a massive 8GB of RAM” 
Several reports in the past had suggested that the Samsung’s upcoming flagship, the Galaxy S8, would be unveiled on April 18th. However, now a new report suggests otherwise. The usually reliable tipster @Ricciolo1 has tipped that the Galaxy S8 will be unveiled at an event on March 29th. #S8 is READY & will be present to mwc,though NOT showcased to big public.. Little bird told me 3/29 , available w17, from 849 !!! #galaxyS8 — Ricciolo (@Ricciolo1) January 16, 2017 
The tipster suggests that the Korean tech giant will showcase the Galaxy S8 to select attendees at MWC, which is scheduled between February 27th and March 2nd. After the public unveiling on March 29th, the phone will go on sale in the week between April 24th and April 30th. The source adds that the Galaxy S8 will be available starting at $849, which is roughly Rs 57,800. 
As far as the specs are concerned, the Samsung Galaxy S8 will be reportedly available in two variants – the Galaxy S8 with a 5.2-inch Super AMOLED 2K display and the Galaxy S8 Plus with a 6.2-inch 2K screen. The phone will bring an 8-megapixel selfie camera with autofocus capabilities, which will be first for a Samsung phone. 
The Galaxy S8 is rumoured to be powered by Qualcomm’s latest Snapdragon 835 flagship mated to an Adreno 540 GPU and up to 8GB of RAM. It will feature a 12MP rear camera, a fingerprint sensor embedded below the display , a curved dual-edged screen, slim bezels, and the highest IP68 dust- and water-resistance.
